H0.text: Blinking is the most likely human response to occur when the air temperature is 90°F.

H1.text: Salivating is the most likely human response when the air temperature is 90 °F.

H2.text: Shivering is the human response most likely to occur because the air temperature is 90°F.

H3.text: Sweating is the human response most likely to occur when the air temperature is 90°F.

A4.text: In hot weather, or when the individual's muscles heat up due to exertion, more sweat is produced.

A5.text: Sweating causes a decrease in core temperature through evaporative cooling at the skin surface.
